attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.

attributes.action: Ban estate agents from managing family members’ properties.
attributes.background: After 6 years of nothing but stress due to a "estate agent" who was related/family member to my landlord renting a badly maintenanced property to me. I want a law in place to protect people who private rent from being put in my place.
attributes.additional_details:
I want restrictions that stop relatives who are estate agents/letting agents renting out properties to people for family members.
 
Estate agents make money renting a place out so not only do they make a financial gain themselves but for their family this would be disallowed in other professions as conflict of interest. 
This also gives the issue I had the place was in disrepair and the estate agent was the manager disregarded any laws in place to protect me as a Tenant to help his family.

attributes.action: Create provision in law for Overtime Payments & max normal hours to be 40/week!
attributes.background: In current Law there is no provision for maximum working week i.e. what hours an employee must work on normal basis and there is no provision for overtime payments. Working over for free IS EXPLOITATION. and we, the working people who are your employers do deserve payment for worked hours!
attributes.additional_details:
Please set the following in the Employment Law: 
- max contractual normal working hours to be 40 hours per week 
 and anything above and over 40hours/week to be considered overtime 
- make an explicit provision in law that any overtime must be paid for 
 and minimum rates shall be: 
 - 1.33x or above for overtime worked on a normal working day 
 - 1.50x or above for overtime worked on Saturday 
 - 2.00x or above for overtime worked on Sunday or Public/Bank Holiday 
Working for Free is EXPLOITATION

attributes.action: Make payment from net income for residential care tax deductible for over 70's
attributes.background: The cost of residential and social care is extremely high. My Mother is 90 years old and has been in a residential home for three years. Her total income does not fully meet her monthly care charges. To alleviate the problem introduce a tax concession on bona fide care costs for those who pay.
attributes.additional_details: It would be a positive gesture from Government to recognise those who have made honest declarations and are subsequently burdened further by the tax system. The Government should also recognise that payments on account for current tax years are also onerous on meeting care costs and should be addressed. The Government should recognise that most people over the age of 70 are not on PAYE and the tax coding system is unreasonable for that population when in care.

attributes.action: Sanitary products must become free of charge to all young women 18 or under.
attributes.background: Girls and young women are struggling to buy sanitary products for themselves which leaves them a unpleasant experience during their period. There are many young women living in poverty who can't provide for themselves so receiving free sanitary products would be beneficial.

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Make all religious organisations give equal opportunities to men and women
attributes.background: Employment opportunities must be open to all without discrimination by law. The same must apply to all employment offered by religious organizations in Britain. The sex of the applicant must be made irrelevant.

attributes.action: Require weekly nature protection classes in schools
attributes.background: I graduated the theoretical high school Stefan Banulescu in Romania. The high school at that time  owned the GREEN FLAG provided by the European Inspectors who mattered with that high school.
attributes.additional_details: I would like environmental protection classes aim at cleaning parks, gardening, proper care of plants and animals. Excursions to the zoo, proximity to the natural environment that is existential to be saved, and many other innovative things that can be brought into discussion in some projects.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Change House of Commons rules so MPs can call each other by their names
attributes.background: Enough is enough, we the people demand this reform in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Widen the A21
attributes.background:
East Sussex only has 11 miles of dual carriageway in the whole county this puts off investors and home buyers to the county as all the roads are slow and congested 
The A21 was planned to be duelled but was scrapped in the 2010 spending review 
The A21 is voted Britain’s most dangerous road
attributes.additional_details:
Widening of the A21 is required from kiplings cross Tunbridge Wells to Hastings 
Lives can be saved and journey times imporoved massively! 
This will give Hastings and East Sussex the infristruture is so desperately needs! 
As a county we have no motorways and pretty much no duel carriageways this causes stress and frustration it’s 2018 it’s about time the government do something to help East Sussex being as the neighboring county of Kent has 3 motorways and plenty of duel caraigeways

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Mental health checkups should be completed yearly from a young age on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health checkups through the NHS should be followed out just as physical health checks are done yearly from a young age.

attributes.action: Keep the tornado in a flying order
attributes.background: The Panavia  tornado has been flying for many years for the golf war and has saved many lives so at least we can do is give a preservation of flying order to it this means to keep it in flying so it won't be scrapped and forgot we have done the same for ww2 aircraft let's do it for the future
attributes.additional_details:
Gulf war - 1991
Kosovo war 
Bosnian war
Iraq war
Libyan Civil war

Also involved with 
Yemen
 afganistan
 Syria

attributes.action: Help fund the NHS so people can have (Otoplasty-Pinnaplasty) surgery.
attributes.background:
I would like to have cosmetic surgery as my ears stick out a bit,  I’ve been to my doctors and seen different doctors and they said I might not be accepted due to funding and not have a good case.

I suffer from Body Dysmorphic Disorder and severe depression, having  ears pinned would help a bit.
attributes.additional_details:
People who need and would like to have Otoplasty surgery can’t get it done due to NHS not funded enough. It costs too much going private and either myself and/or other people who want Otoplasty can’t afford it. It’s not right that myself or others would have to go private. The cost is about £2,500-£3,500 plus any consultations etc.

I want to get this done as it’s causimg me significant Psychological distress and others feel the same. I don’t want to go privately to get cosmetic surgery.

attributes.action: Provide Network Rail with funding for the second entrance at Putney Station
attributes.background:
Wandsworth Council have been pushing for a 2nd entrance to Putney Station for years, but have failed to secure funding.

This project would improve access between SWT and District Line and reduce congestion in the main entrance. Please back this project with government funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Wandsworth Council article showing the benefits to locals:
http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/13181/rail_passengers_urged_to_quiz_rail_chiefs_on_new_station_entrance

Local Guardian article about the plans:
http://www.yourlocalguardian.co.uk/news/10636235.Train_bosses_urged_to_consider_second_entrance_plan_for_Putney_station/

Putney High Street is also one of the most polluted roads in London, so this project would have health benefits, as well as saving time for passengers.

attributes.action: Proscribe the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League
attributes.background: Members of the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League have been attacking people, including women, elderly, indigenous peoples, students.
attributes.additional_details:
We appeal for peace and justice and that is why we are reaching out to international community to find avenues to protect children of Bangladesh. We are seeking your help! To start with, Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League needs to be recognized and proscribed by the UK as a terrorist organization.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-45069935
 
http://www.foxnews.com/world/2018/08/04/police-protesters-clash-in-bangladesh-capital-many-injured.html”

attributes.action: To make the M5 north and south bond to 4/5 lanes wide from Exeter to Bristol.
attributes.background: The M5 north and south bond is one of the most congested motorways in the country and each week thousands of people are stuck in heavy traffic jams turning1 hour trips into 4 hours of stand still traffic. Extending each side to 4 or 5 lanes would increase the flow of traffic and decrease congestion.

attributes.action: Outlaw councils from banning dogs from public beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.background: Most dog owners pick up their dog waste and control their  dogs. People work all week or all even year for those magic moments on a beach with their family and dog, only to find dogs are not allowed on many beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: More litter/dog wardens could be employed giving offenders high on the spot fines.

attributes.action: Make using red flashing lights on recovery trucks mandatory.
attributes.background: In 2018 alone we have had some very tragic incidents on the roads that could of been prevented. A lack of concentration whilst driving at speed is killing innocent workers. More needs to be done to protect workers roadside. Hitting a stationary vehicle on the hard shoulder shouldn't happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike blue flashing lights, amber lights grant no priority in traffic and are used to solely to emphasize a vehicle, often due to being a hazard. AKA non important
.Vehicles that use amber flashing lights include:

Road / highway maintenance vehicle 
Refuse collection vehicle
Breakdown recovery vehicle
the list goes on.

Most vehicles that do any kind of civil work have amber flashing lights, they are abused and misused, giving drivers the indication they are not important. This needs to change. All recovery trucks to have flashing reds fitted so motorist understand drivers need the room to operate. Workers to return home safe, not in a coffin.

attributes.action: UK Government should work with Dumfries and Galloway Council to house refugees
attributes.background: Many refugees live in awful horrible conditions and we do not. There is so much space here in Dumfries and Galloway and I want the refugees to have the same opportunities that we have.
attributes.additional_details: Countries close to war torn countries have begun to refuse letting in refugees. It is a selfish act to deprive others of the things we take for granted every day. Let refugees come here.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16!
attributes.background: The government are deciding what happens with the next generation’s future, yet they don’t get a say in it. Young people should get the vote, because they will have to raise their children in the environment that the government make.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates for pigs
attributes.background: I know that sadly the last petition on the issue ended without receiving a debate. Pigs have high cognitive intelligence that has been proven to be higher than that of cats and dogs - it is cruel enough to put them through the pain of death and unwanted pregnancy, but a farrowing crate is torture.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.seeker.com/iq-tests-suggest-pigs-are-smart-as-dogs-chimps-1769934406.html
For those who do not know, a farrowing carts is a metal cage where pigs spend 5 weeks unable to turn around during the pain of pregnancy and a few weeks thereafter. Many pigs go through this process a number of times in their life so are unable to access their young or nurture them properly.
https://lib.dr.iastate.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1102&context=ans_pubs

attributes.action: Ban school uniforms
attributes.background: People encourage you to express yourselves yet you can't when trapped in expensive and useless uniform
attributes.additional_details: You only wear school uniform for approximately 30/720 hours a week! You pay so much money and hardly wear it also you are often restricted to looking plain (you hardly can wear jewellery makeup or have your hair dyed). The schools often encourage you to 'express yourselves' yet we are trapped in a plain and boring uniform. We have good enough clothes and rules as to what you can wear can easily be introduced if we remove school uniform. There is no point wasting money on uneeded extra clothes.

attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Give under 18's free self-test STI kits
attributes.background: Self-test kits for STIs are also available online and on the high street. They include home testing kits for infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhoea that you can send away to a laboratory. This could be a huge help to the amount of people who are nervous or shy to go to such clinic to be tested.

attributes.action: Ban strip clubs in the UK. Strip clubs are demeaning and sexually exploitive.
attributes.background: Ban strip clubs in the UK. They are demeaning, degrading and sexually exploitive to women. Whilst these establishments exist they pose a major obstacle to achieving equality between the sexes. Strip clubs convey the idea that women can be bought and hold no value. It is well past time for change.
attributes.additional_details: Strip clubs have no place in a civilised society where equality should be the norm, not the exception. It is time for women to be treated with respect and valued for more than their bodies. Allowing such an industry to exist encourages sexual violence and exploitation to women. Let's adopt the icelandic approach and ban these outdated institutions. If society does not value women enough to ban this archaic display of sexism then how can we expect women to value themselves. It is time for change.

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Invest in developing a hyperloop system instead of HS2
attributes.background: HS2 (high speed train 2) and train lines could become outdated technology. A hyper-loop uses a partially evacuated pipeline with the carriage moving on a maglev (magnetic levitation) within.
attributes.additional_details:
It could be much faster and, I believe, safer, cheaper, quieter and better for the environment than trains and aeroplanes. A fully developed and implemented hyper-loop could be far more cost effective and have many more benefits than a train line or indeed aeroplanes. Hyper-loops could allow people and goods to travel at speeds similar to a jet aeroplane with fewer costs, risks and inconvenience. Various worldwide companies are already starting to build hyperloop prototypes. 

The UK should be at the forefront of this development. It would be a great step forward in the connectivity of people and business nationally and would greatly benefit the whole country. The money would be much better spent than on unpopular and older technology such as HS2.

attributes.action: Remove Abellio Greater Anglia from servicing the Greater Anglia rail network.
attributes.background: The Abellio Greater Anglia service worsens on a monthly basis, all the while annually raising rail fares inexplicably. Cancellations, regularly late running trains, reduced carriages, overcrowding, extortionate fares. No remorse for their customers & no sign of reinvestment in the service. Get rid!
attributes.additional_details:
I am lucky if my daily commute from Bishop's Stortford to London is ever on time or disrupted in one way or another. I pay approximately  £500 a month, or £6,000 for a service which is miles away from being worth it, but I am left with little option to get to work each day (if I'm lucky).

Fares have beeing increased nearly 10% in the last 4 years and there have been no improvements made. Broken down trains which don't get replaced. Trains are late EVERY DAY. Trains are overcrowded.

attributes.action: The UK legal definition of rape should change to the US version.
attributes.background: The UK law means only penetration with a penis is considered rape. Instead, the US version should be used. This covers all forms of forced penetration. Penetration from an object can cause the same trauma as when penetrated by a penis, yet these victims attackers can get off more lightly.
attributes.additional_details:
UK DEFINITION

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape

Definition of rape - ( This version means only men can be charged and only when using their penis. )

"he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
(b)B does not consent to the penetration, and
(c)A does not reasonably believe that B consents."


US DEFINITION 

https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/blog/updated-definition-rape

Definition of rape - 

“The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.”

attributes.action: Remove 'Mrs' and 'Miss' on all government docs & forms and use only 'Ms' instead
attributes.background: Why is it that women designate their marital status when men don't? It's 2018, this indirect sexism shouldn't be supported by the UK government. 'Miss' and 'Mrs' have no place in this era of equality, let's have them replaced by one single designation 'Ms'; just like 'Mr' and the now disused 'Mstr'.

attributes.action: Renegotiate the Brexit deal immediately in the event MPs vote against it
attributes.background: If MPs vote against the Brexit deal, the Government shall immediatley seek to negotiate an improved deal, including ensuring the U.K. will have a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario thereby honouring the leave vote and working to avoid a “no deal” scenario
attributes.additional_details: The referendum vote to leave is compromised by the inability of the U.K. to unilaterally leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario. In the highly likely event MPs vote against the deal the Government must commit to return to the EU to negotiate an improved deal, for example to amend the Withdrawal Agreement to create a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario and to reduce the Brexit bill; to be done immediatley and urgently after the vote

attributes.action: Require schools to buy text books made from recycled materials.
attributes.background: In school, we have been looking at deforestation and the causes and impacts of it. As an individual I have realized that a major issue for deforestation is the need for paper and other school supplies. Instead of cutting down more trees we should use recycled materials to help the environment!
attributes.additional_details: Each year, globally, we are losing 18.7 million acres of forests. Due to this we are left with only 3000 wild tigers across the world. It has been shown that the amazon rain-forest has lost 17% of its trees in the past 50 years, due to forest conversion. In addition, it is shown that trees are our carbon sinks, therefore proving that they inhale the carbon we cant. If they cant inhale this carbon it will be let off into the atmosphere. 15% of all greenhouse gases are due to deforestation.

attributes.action: Fund more research into Endometriosis
attributes.background: Endometriosis is the name given to the condition where cells like the ones in the lining of the womb (uterus) are found elsewhere in the body. The actual cause of endometriosis is unknown. Around 1.5 million women in the UK are currently living with the condition.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis.
 
Endometriosis is the second most common gynaecological condition in the UK.
 
Endometriosis affects 1.5 million women, a similar number of women affected by diabetes.
 
On average it takes 7.5 years from onset of symptoms to get a diagnosis.
 
Endometriosis costs the UK economy £8.2bn a year in treatment, loss of work and healthcare costs.
 
https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/information

attributes.action: Individuals should pay half the amount of tax on overtime.
attributes.background:
In order to better your financial position and that of your family you should be able to pay only half the amount of tax on any hours worked as overtime compared to what you work as normal hours. 
This arrangement would encourage people into work and boost production and productivity for employers.

attributes.action: Simplify planning use classes by combine A1, A2, B1 and D1.
attributes.background: Planning requires change of use, which is expensive.  This is just red-tape.  Many categories overlaps.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planning_use_classes_in_England

attributes.action: Sanction Jair Bolsonsaro’s Brazil if they reverse laws protecting the Amazon.
attributes.background: Jair Bolsonsaro government threatens to destroy the Amazon rainforest. It is the responsibility of the world’s other nations to intervene. The destruction of the world’s most valuable ecological resource will have knock on environmental effects that threaten the whole planet and not just Brazil.

attributes.action: Make it a law in the Porn industry all STD’s to be on sexual health certificates
attributes.background: I have worked in the Porn industry for the past 3 years and believe that sexual health is very important. On a sexual health certificate that we provide for Porn companies and performers in order to be able to work I believe should include every sexually transmitted infection instead of just some!
attributes.additional_details: In the Porn industry we are required to be tested every 28 days and have to provide a sexual health screening certificate to Porn companies and other performers in order to be able to work, how ever on the current certificates Porn companies and performers do not require all STD’s to be present on the certificate therefore people are still at risk of catching infections such as: Trichomoiasis, Herpes, Mycoplasma Genitalium and more! This is a big concern and I believe this should be a law.
